post.body:
Don't save your ZeroNet files as UTF 8-BOM (I used Notepad++), or there will be error.

I had posts with no title/body on ZeroTalk and could not move to another ZeroMe Hub, but after changing to simple UTF-8, it has been fixed.
Thanks to @Nofish: that helped me on [this issue](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1576).

FrameworkJS is near to be launched.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Fmwk685eaX7GjoQ7JKo3QvywizGfnYRCB/
Ask your questions in our forum:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DS3W1EqALVYyyWoKxFPezffx2V6e8gzTU/

Soon Peeper will be relaunched, and both [Peeper](http://127.0.0.1:43110/peeper.bit/?Profile/1N9sU8qh3S4ei9PHE1qQyYPbcckJomvwMd/15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy1vqCe/daniell@zeroid.bit)/[ChameleonHub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N9sU8qh3S4ei9PHE1qQyYPbcckJomvwMd/) will support [KxoID](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GTVetvjTEriCMzKzWSP9FahYoMPy6BG1P/).

Lots  of users joined ZeroNet on 2016, and left, because they didn't saw good zites/features on zites.
Probability of return of those users is very low.

[ChameleonHub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N9sU8qh3S4ei9PHE1qQyYPbcckJomvwMd/) is one of a few hubs that supports background.jpg file.
This file should be optional, not?
Why the upload of background was not allowed on 0net proxy?
New design of [ChameleonHub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N9sU8qh3S4ei9PHE1qQyYPbcckJomvwMd/), with color transition and GIFs.

For who owns a hub, it is a weird fact:

* You create another profile on this hub
* An user of this hub comment on the post of this profile, offending
* You have the possibility of ban this user, but you don't want to do it

It is what happened on my hub, I will don't ban a user just because he is ignorant.

I'm using a platform where we use test tokens (Beta$) and also the real ones (CoinBundle - BNDL) to buy invesment bundles/packages.
I earned about 350 BNDL tokens and lots of Beta$, and they are running a investment competition (you don't need real money to invest) and bounty campaigns with simple tasks.

If you want to begin earning 100 BNDL tokens just for signup, this is the link:

https://beta.coinbundle.com/signup?ref=GbilASc06z9MvDBxOoBlc4iDCT3uw2odDfb157vwFMN3GHFGvr9JHCU0tfIjGDd76K%2BfZOv6h9N3WsIWu0hSI1or06JD4g%2FUbLw2uHciwUc%3D
*Note* it is a link to clearnet.

My Tox chat ID:
> 14E22FA1844FF2819857CC13156A4F88864BAC7CDEED52780D54631E92DA6C21BC9D2F35E690

An user that keeps domains rechognized me as Plasmmer, owner of Peeper and other zites, and is about to send the domains I didn't renewed (because a error that corrupted my Namecoin wallet).

This user is amazing!

But I don't say the username, because I don't know if he wants I saying about it.

Soon [Peeper](http://127.0.0.1:43110/peeper.bit/) will receive new updates.

Sent all domains!
Thanks
Now I can resume the development of Peeper and other
Your greatest enemy and best friend: youself.

Everyone is enemy, till the contrary is proven.
Make your self-defence on, don't trust, or trust not trusting.
Don't trust and don't be comforted with you-self: analyze, critique, do "sacrificial" effort, improve.
Planet Earth surely will never have a revolution done by human hands.
The problem of who hates you is not you: they hates the whole existence.
Never use social media when you are sleepy.

It's nonsense

# List of most needed things for ZeroNet:

* Cryptocurrency

* Sites handling against bad content on start page (for sample, NSFW)
* Better localization/multilanguage
* Data synced on multiple devices
* Clearnet [most needed services/apps](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1BVGUB9cyZjUJJbRtQZmgS4YpZE1v8Nn1R/needed.html), with similar sites on ZeroNet
* Recommended decentralized ID (that relies on ZeroNet, working for mesh network users)
* P2P ZeroNet updates as default
* Help offline users gets files from online users (LocalAnnounce plugin)
* Built-in with mesh networks that are discoverable by offline users

* Protection for proxies (filters, mod review, logs, terms of use)
* Friendly user login on proxies
* Dedicated proxies: Clearnet presence and attraction to ZeroNet
* Incentive clearnet proxies users to download ZeroNet

* Dedicated program/app for a zite

* Share API
* Support IPv6
* Built-in in operating systems
* Browser to access zero:// protocol
* URL rewriting (no /?/ in the URLs)

* Proof-of-work
* Verification on ZeroID
* Ads

Updated version of this list on [GitHub](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1621).

Well, if you see this [stats](https://www.statista.com/statistics/273018/number-of-internet-users-worldwide/), even on 2005 Internet had more than 1 billion people.

# KxoID implemented on ZeroMe

[Peeper](http://127.0.0.1:43110/peeper.bit/) and [ChameleonHub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N9sU8qh3S4ei9PHE1qQyYPbcckJomvwMd/) now supports signup/login with KxoID, the first decentralized ID provider with unique usernames.

If you want to use KxoID on ZeroMe, you need to access using Peeper (when you need to signup/login, then you can use ZeroMe) and move your profile to [KxoHub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LqcxtENM69yBggxPYLaj87J4bqon5SVwU/) or ChameleonHub.

# ZeroNet scalability: SharedSearch plugin
@blurhy:
I was thinking that ZeroNet would fail scalability because of search.
But I figured today a form of handle it: SharedSearch plugin, where users sends request headers to other peers, containing search words, site and hubs where the content is already locally searched (to avoid waste of resources from those peers). Then this user can share with other peers a list of those searcheable peers.

If you uses clearnet services, then you can reveal your identy on ZeroNet (for your own security): the world's worst people already knows you.

https://github.com/shadowsocks/shadowsocks
https://github.com/clowwindy

Because we don't know the photo or name of "clowwindy", we don't know what happened. Is "clowwindy" alive? Anything could be made in secret.

Tor is a lie, and because of it Nofish doesn't wants to implement i2p on ZeroNet.
Some users defends Nofish, and ZeroMux that was not defending, disappeared.

# ZeroNet存在严重的安全漏洞

如果您收到有关新更新的警报，则是因为它。
我已经弄清楚如何利用它，但我无法分享细节。
如果您不更新客户端，并且通过ZeroHello / ZeroUpdate更新，则存在风险。

＃ 不要被黑客攻击

**我建议所有用户，不要更新ZEROHELLO。 从GITHUB下载并添加到/ CORE文件夹。 还要将REPO克隆到/ CORE文件夹中，这样你就可以分析文件的变化**。
我愿意教它如何设置它。

----

# ZeroNet is with a critical security flaw

If you received a alert about new update, is because of it.
I already figure out how this can be exploited, but I can't share the details.
You is in risk, both if you don't update your client, and if you update via the ZeroHello/ZeroUpdate.

# Don't get hacked

**I ADVICE TO ALL USERS, DOESN'T UPDATE FROM ZEROHELLO. DOWNLOAD FROM GITHUB AND ADD TO /CORE FOLDER. ALSO CLONE THE REPO INTO THE /CORE FOLDER, SO YOU CAN ANALYZE WHAT ARE THE FILES CHANGED**.
I'm open to teach how to setup it.

# 更新到最新的ZeroNet后 (rev3616)

**如果你不遵守这条补习，那么你就有可能拥有一个零的ZERONET版本！**

[希望您使用git手动更新ZeroNet，而不是从ZeroHello更新它](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1538339767_15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy1vqCe).

我建议大家删除ZeroUpdate zite，关闭ZeroHello并从git中修补ZeroHello。 或删除ZeroHello并再次下载。

----

# After updating to the latest ZeroNet (rev3616)

**IF YOU DON'T FOLLOW THIS TUTORIAL, YOU IS IN RISK TO HAVE A HACKED VERSION OF ZERONET!**

[Hope you updated ZeroNet manually, with git, instead of risky updating it from ZeroHello](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1538339767_15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy1vqCe).

I suggest you all to delete ZeroUpdate zite, close ZeroHello and patch ZeroHello from git. Or delete ZeroHello and download again.

ZeroNews has been relaunched:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/znews.bit/

# How to enable IPv6 and make ZeroNet more accessible/secure/reliable

Download:
https://github.com/tangdou1/ZeroNet/archive/patch-2.zip
and extract it to your ZeroNet's core folder.

If you want to begin with a IPv6 tracker, you can add this: zero://fc81:4668:5a19:0c29:9dfe:ed94:d745:85c9

# How to create and share your own IPv6 tracker
1. On Windows, download [CJDNS installer](https://github.com/interfect/cjdns-installer). On Linux, download CJDNS from apt or other method you want. Ask me and I'll help about your questions.
2. Close ZeroNet. Install and run CJDNS and make sure it is working properly
3. Go to your ZeroNet folder, enter on core folder and then plugins folder
4. Find the disabled-Bootstrapper folder, and remove the disabled-
5. Open your ZeroNet
6. Copy your IPv6 address and share it

# Graduate Student Solves Quantum Verification Problem | Quanta Magazine

Urmila Mahadev spent eight years in graduate school solving one of the most basic questions in quantum computation: How do you know whether a quantum computer has done anything quantum at all?

* [Source](https://www.quantamagazine.org/graduate-student-solves-quantum-verification-problem-20181008)

Now I understand the point of dat:// protocol and its Beaker browser.
An P2P web protocol bundled into a browser is being made to beat ZeroNet.

# Your zite supporting dark theme with no efforts

FrameworkJS, the ZeroNet first click-to-clone framework, now supports ZeroNet automatic dark theme.
If you begin your ZeroNet zite with FrameworkJS, your project will automatically support dark/light themes.

Also, VueJS/AngularJS has been replaced by Twitter's Bootstrap.

If you see big buttons, it is because FrameworkJS is yet on beta development stage, and fixing bugs after implementation of Bootstrap.

* [Test FrameworkJS](http://127.0.0.1:43110/fmwk.bit/)

When I think it will be need, I'll fork Material Icons and find out how to add new icons, creating a updated clone.
The first introduced icon will be ZeroNet icon.

# FrameworkJS has been launched!
**On ZeroNet, no need to recreate the same things for every new project you begin. Framework.js already comes with the basic libs and features ZeroNet needs**.

It already includes the basic features expected from a web framework, plus more!
It includes, for reading: Headings, Paragraphs, Blockquotes, Badges, Images, Navbar, Logo
For forms: buttons, sticky buttons, inputs, text areas
For webpage/app: navbar/header, header menu, navmenu, scroller, footer
Other elements: Tiled lists, longcard lists
CSS classes: .full-size, .no-opacity, .color, .color-bg

**For ZeroNet, FrameworkJS is the first usable framework, and the world's first click-to-clone web framework.
On FrameworkJS site, just click "Create your own zite", and it will redirect to your brand new project. You can also use FrameworkJS on your current project.
Zite owner can call JS to clone your own site or another site. Also, FrameworkJS is doing the begin of UltraApps with the detection of clearnet/zeronet, and supports ZeroNet dark theme. It also comes with the most useful ZeroNet libs**.

Framework isn't better, because ZeroNet didn't implemented yet the new features I suggested for site clonning.

FrameworkJS also includes Bootstrap and Material Design ready to use.

Use it on your project, and copy/paste the JS/CSS (except the custom ones) when a new version of Framework is launched.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/fmwk.bit/
http://framework.js.org/
https://github.com/Plasnerd/Framework.js/releases/tag/r1

I have an announcement about @Peeper:
This project is paused for now, and when resumed, it will not be based on ZeroMe, but developed from scratch. But it will have compatibility/portability with ZeroMe data.

----

Problems of ZeroMe:
* User needs to post only in a hub, and can't reach too much users because it depends if they seed the hub
* Hubs haves posting limits, instead of making posts as optional files

----

How will be the new Peeper:
* Redesign
* User seeds the category he/she wants, and can post on categories
* Users are stored on hubs related to countries/languages, but all of them will be organized and promoted on Peeper to have seeds
* New posts are instantly seeded by users for some enough time to get seeds, and after it they will not be automatically seeded, giving priority to other new posts
* Peeps haves a maximum character count like Twitter
* Alongside Peeps, user can do posts, that are metered with word count, to be listed in a section that works like Medium
* Audios, videos, conversations and quotes will also supported to post
*  User can import data/posts from other social network's zip files, and even ZeroMe (the posts will have a icon about the social network it came)
* Can ask/answer to users (like Ask.fm)
* Peeps and questions/answers are threaded, like on Twitter
* Can react, share and tip peeps/posts/questions/answers
* A ZeroNet chat will be embed on Peeper
* Discussion groups/communities
* Events
* Profiles can be liked
* Can post on other's wall
* Own wall with pinned and organized posts

Funny thing is that, since 2011 projecting Peeper, now there is a [project with a similar name](https://peepeth.com/) and calling the posts as "peeps"!

I know I'm a newbie user, and ZeroNet devs doesn't believes on me; but with Eventlr, creating Peeper from scratch is possible. Also, other newbie users will have possibility to contribute to Peeper using Eventlr.

A few days ago I'd discovered that Steemit is open-source and runs through an platform that isn't Ethereum: STEEM. But after seeing that their Keyring extension is available just for Chromium and it depends on register/username (and needs to be approved by Steemit team), I knew it is centralized. But after searching about it, I had sure:

https://decentralize.today/the-ugly-truth-behind-steemit-1a525f5e156

There are lots of useful dApps for STEEM, that aren't on Ethereum, but are amazing:
https://www.stateofthedapps.com/dapps/platform/steem?page=1

These dApps (including Steemit), as open-source, could be ported to ZeroNet and Ethereum

"Privacy? I don't have anything to hide"

Glenn Greenwald in Why privacy matters - TED Talk:
Over the last 16 months, as I've debated this issue around the world, every single time somebody has said to me, "I don't really worry about invasions of privacy because I don't have anything to hide." I always say the same thing to them. I get out a pen, I write down my email address. I say, "Here's my email address. What I want you to do when you get home is email me the passwords to all of your email accounts, not just the nice, respectable work one in your name, but all of them, because I want to be able to just troll through what it is you're doing online, read what I want to read and publish whatever I find interesting. After all, if you're not a bad person, if you're doing nothing wrong, you should have nothing to hide." Not a single person has taken me up on that offer.
